components.name: Titanium SDK & CLI
components.description: Please enter tickets related to the MobileSDK here.

fields.description:
I have a webview that fire events inside the webview when user clicks on links and interacts with form elements. This functionality works fine when building for emulator or device but when building for distribution nothing happens when clicking links or any other form elements in the webview. Maybe the distribution target removes some important files, could be related to TIMOB-3395.

As a workaround I use the build for emulator and signs it with my store key, but I don't know if there are any other things I miss when doing it this way. This should definitely be fixed before 1.7 final release.
fields.summary: Distribution build for Android breaks events in webview

comments.body:
In order for us to progress this issue, edit your ticket to include a proper [Use-case|http://wiki.appcelerator.org/display/guides/Contributing+to+Titanium#ContributingtoTitanium-CreatingGoodUsecases].

Also, state your environment, including Titanium SDK version (and, if using a Continuous Build, date + commit hash), and the Android versions for emulator and device.

Please read the [Submitting Bug Reports|http://wiki.appcelerator.org/display/guides/Contributing+to+Titanium#ContributingtoTitanium-SubmittingBugReports] guide before raising tickets.

Thank you
No response from user after request for information. Marking resolved.
